thread.section_title: Manchester United will make up for October thrashing against Chelsea, says Chris Smalling – Metro
thread.title: Manchester United will make up for October thrashing against Chelsea, says Chris Smalling
thread.title_full: Manchester United will make up for October thrashing against Chelsea, says Chris Smalling

author: louissealey1
title: Manchester United will make up for October thrashing against Chelsea, says Chris Smalling
text:
Manchester United and England defender Chris Smalling (Picture: Getty) Chris Smalling is adamant there will be no repeat of the thrashing Manchester United suffered in October when the Red Devils travel to Chelsea on Monday.
United suffered their heaviest defeat under Jose Mourinho when the Portuguese boss returned to Stamford Bridge for the first time since his sacking earlier in the season.
Tottenham star Heung-min Son targeted by racist abuse from Millwall fans The Blues sealed a convincing 4-0 victory five months ago but Smalling insists United will give a better account of themselves this time around in the FA Cup.
‘Chelsea have been by far the most consistent team in the league and they deserve to be in the position where they are now,’ England defender Smalling said.
‘But I think we are on a good run and we will give a much better account of ourselves than we did last time.
‘In the lead-up to that week, we had drawn with Liverpool and won in Europe too, so we were starting to build up momentum.
Antonio Conte’s side are the short favourites to progress in the FA Cup (Picture: Getty) ‘Then that game at Chelsea completely knocked us – it was definitely one of our worst performances of the season. But from then on we have kicked on and done a lot better.
More: Football The horrific moment Harry Kane's leg bends the wrong way during Spurs vs Millwall 
Ozil: My future does NOT depend on Wenger staying at Arsenal 
Conte: This Chelsea star is already much better than I was 
‘I think we all learned a lot of things from that game and, not only do we have progress in this competition to play for, we also have our pride as well.’
MORE: Chelsea duo feeling confident ahead of Man United clash
